result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald S Hooverson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Stalking, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.32(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Cases 14CF284 & 14CF294 called together at 9:44 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Ronald S Hooverson in court, in-custody, with Attorney David Zarwell. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

BOTH CASES: Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Hooverson waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
14CF294:State files information; Arraignment:--service of Information admitted, reading waived--maximum penalties recited

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #1-14CF294; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #2, #3 & #4-14CF294 & Case 14CF284
Sentencing Arguments by Counsel: Recess: 10:24 am for Court to review documents Reconvene: 10:36 am 

On Count #1-14CF294, the Court sentences the Defendant to 3 years prison; with 1 year initial confinement and 2 years extended supervision. This sentence is IMPOSED & STAYED and the Court places the Defendant on Probation for 2 years with conditions:
--Mental Health Assessment & follow-through with treatment
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--To attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--No contact with Jill DeLuna or Caitlin H. unless they and the Agent agree and the injunction is modified
--No possession of dangerous weapons
--To pay costs of $268
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
Sentence may transfer to another State is authorized

If revoked, the Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for CIP & are eligible for ERP
If revoked, conditions of probation become conditions of extended supervision

Days credit for time already served: 93 days
Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibitions Warnings Form Given
Court orders that bayonet be destroyed pursuant to 968.20
Recess: 10:48 am
Preliminary hearing on November 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Ronald S Hooverson
Current: 411 S Center Ave., c/o Jefferson County Jail, Jefferson, WI 53549   (Effective: 08-21-2014)
Prior: Jefferson County Jail 411 S Center Ave, Jefferson, WI 53549

Cases 14CF284 & 14CF294 called together at 1:18 pm [Clerk SH]  (case set for Status and Competency Hearing)
Defendant Ronald S Hooverson in court, in custody, with Attorney David Zarwell. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Counsel agree they have had enough time to review competency report
Atty Zarwell: Not contesting findings, will not request evidentiary hearing
Upon questioning of the Court, Mr. Hooverson agrees
ADA Hall: State does agree with medical doctor's opinion
Court finds Mr. Hooverson is competent to proceed in these cases
Atty Zarwell requests matters be set for preliminary hearing as soon as possible
14CF294: Service of the complaint admitted; reading waived
Court indicates that since Mr. Hooverson is incarcerated, It will not require payment plan on Atty fees, will address in the future. Informs Mr. Hooverson that he wil be required to reimburse atty fees at some point on these cases
Court continues bond
Recess: 1:23 pm

Status conference on October 31, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

Cases 14CF284 & 14CF294 called together at 8:41 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Ronald S Hooverson in court, in custody. DA Susan V. Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court reviews case file documents and letter submitted by non-party re: Defendant's psychiatric needs
DA Happ indicates that the State would not object to adjourning, presents basis including possible Defendant's need for counsel

Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given.
Mr. Hooverson informs the Court that he would like counsel on this matter, but does not have means to retain counsel
Court informs parties that It believes should appoint counsel in these matters, informs Mr. Hooverson of paperwork to complete and submit to the Court once petition for Court appointed counsel form is completed. Clerk provides form to Mr. Hooverson
Recess: 8:45 am Reconvene: 9:34 am
Appearances are the same; Mr. Hooverson submits petition for appointment of counsel
Court swears Mr. Hooverson as to petition; Court has colloquy with Mr. Hooverson regarding petition/finances
Court presents basis, finds Mr. Hooverson partially indigent and appoints Attorney David Zarwell; no repayment schedule made at this time
Court finds that Mr. Hooverson has waived applicable time limits for preliminary hearing
Atty Zarwell appears: 9:40 am
Court informs Atty Zarwell of the schedule STC/Initial Appearance-Mr. Zarwell indicates he can not appear that date & new date is given in Court

14CF294: 
Court orders $1500 cash bond to cover both cases with conditions:
--No acts/threats of violence
--No presence at Lake Mills Oasis
--no direct or indirect contact with Jill Deluna or the daughter of Ms. Deluna
--no presence on Manske Road in Lake Mills
--no possession of dangerous weapons as defined by Statute
Recess: 9:44 am 

NEXT: BOTH CASES (1) Schedule STC (14CF284)/Initial Appearance (14CF294)  9/19/14 at 1:30 pm  - Send notices
